meanings.definition: A weathervane in the shape of a rooster.
meanings.sent1: The weathercock on top of the barn pointed north.
meanings.sent2: I could see the weathercock spinning in the wind on the church steeple.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to catch the shiny weathercock on the roof.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was like a weathercock, changing direction with every passing cloud.
meanings.sent5: The weathercock gleamed in the sunlight, a beacon for lost travelers.

meanings.definition: A person who frequently changes their opinions or allegiances.
meanings.sent1: He was known as a weathercock in the political arena, always shifting his support.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't trust him as he was a weathercock, never staying loyal for long.
meanings.sent3: The weathercock of the office, he never stuck to one decision for too long.
meanings.sent4: Her friend was a weathercock, blowing hot and cold on various topics.
meanings.sent5: The weathercock politician changed sides so often, no one knew where his true beliefs lay.
